cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles ESE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Gradually lifting northwest across the central and north-western Bahamas, then turning north-northwest to skirt the Florida east coast this weekend and curving north-northeast just offshore the Georgia–South Carolina coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along or near the east-central Florida coast (Jupiter Inlet to Flagler/Volusia County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet FL northward to the Flagler-Volusia County line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Florida northward through the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible; peak cumulative chance 23% for >34 kt, 4% for >50 kt
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected to exceed 3 ft along Georgia coast at this time
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rainfall possible as outer bands spread northward Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor coastal flooding at high tide possible
